alert.note: Alert for Fisher; Jones (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 07 at 6:59PM CDT until May 07 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN FISHER AND WESTERN JONES COUNTIES... At 656 PM CDT, Nearly stationary thunderstorms with heavy rainfall continued from Roby to Sylvester to McCaulley and Neinda. Additional storms near Noodle were moving north at 20 mph. Between 3 and 3.25 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 2 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Anson, Hawley, Noodle, Sylvester, Longworth, The Intersection Of Us-180 And Ranch Road 126, Truby, Stith, Hodges and Funston. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... CO Rd. 444 crossing Noodle Creek and County Road 260 crossing Harmony Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
